title: Tony McGahan
text:
Tony McGahan is an Australian <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> coach who is currently an assistant coach at the <a href="Queensland%20Reds">Queensland Reds</a>.
Early career.
Born in <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a>, Australia, a teacher by profession, a BE in Physical Education from <a href="Queensland%20University%20of%20Technology">Queensland University of Technology</a>, he played Rugby Union (inside centre) with Queensland Schoolboys and Eastern Districts and Rugby League with Queensland U16s/19s, Australian Universities.
Munster.
In July 2008, McGahan took up the position as the director of coaching of <a href="Munster%20Rugby">Munster</a> following <a href="Declan%20Kidney">Declan Kidney</a>'s departure to take over as <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a> coach. He had been involved with the Munster team since 2005 as the defence and backs coach.
In May 2011 he coached Munster to win the <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Celtic%20League">2010–11 Celtic League</a> <a href="2011%20Celtic%20League%20Grand%20Final">Grand Final</a> against <a href="Leinster%20Rugby">Leinster</a> at <a href="Thomond%20Park">Thomond Park</a>.
McGahan left Munster at the end of the 2011–12 season, to take up a role as Australian defence coach.
Australia.
McGahan took up the role of coaching co-ordinator of Australia after leaving Munster at the end of the 2011–12 European domestic season.
He became coach of the <a href="Melbourne%20Rebels">Melbourne Rebels</a> at the end of the <a href="2013%20Super%20Rugby%20season">2013 Super Rugby season</a>.
